result.execSummary:
The defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

**Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.**

Letter of apology to JCPenney's, Macy's and Walmart.
Participate in vocational training.

AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has 3 cases pending.  The State has only 1 file in court.  Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is ready to change her plea but the State only has 1 of the 3 files.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance is waived for today's date. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety.   vp
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court earlier.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM021662  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/24/2015
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - Missed office contact/missed drug test and portable breathalyzer.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SOUTHRIDGE MALL & JCPENNY'S; SCU OR HIS/HER FAMILY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
